text: To all the farmers, grocery store workers, truck & delivery drivers, I say thank you! Along with fellow Hoosiers we are grateful for your hard work and dedication helping everyone get through this difficult time. https://t.co/wkiyPi4LTB

Today is #CensusDay. 

The data from the census helps allocate federal funds to hospitals, fire departments, schools, roads & other resources.

You can complete the census online, by phone, or by mail.

Today, staff will host mobile office hours at the Kentland Library today from 12PM (ET) to 3PM (ET). Feel free to stop by and say hello. They will be happy to assist with casework issues like social security, veteran benefits, passports and more.

Today, on the House floor, I honored the memory of Bryan Metzger. He served his community, most recently as President of the Tippecanoe County Council. His commitment to family, friends and his community is a shining example of service and passion. Bryan will be dearly missed. https://t.co/MegXGSIove

Another outstanding jobs report:
- 273,000 jobs added
- wages up 3% from a year earlier
- unemployment still at 50-year lows
 
In addition, the previous two months revised their numbers UP bringing the three-month average up to a robust 243,000!

Indiana has a dedicated team of state and local officials who are working tirelessly to keep us protected from the coronavirus. I commend their efforts in handling Indiana’s first confirmed case of the virus and keeping the public informed.

Great economic news from Kokomo! 
 
Fiat Chrysler Automobiles will create almost 200 new jobs and retain 1,000 more. The company will reopen an idled transmission plan and produce engines that will power the Jeep Wrangler and Jeep Cherokee. 
https://t.co/yKJofcS8LJ

Proud to introduce the Industries of the Future Act with several colleagues today. The legislation will help maintain our country’s workforce as a global leader in industries like artificial intelligence, 5G networks, and advanced manufacturing. 

https://t.co/CIIBsH9BN7

Purdue University has shown it's possible to keep college affordable while delivering a high quality education. 

- Tuition has been kept under $10,000 for seven straight years
- Nearly 60% of undergrads leave school without any debt
https://t.co/EvnhCiFkLF

Today, I voted in support of the emergency supplemental package to provide essential funding to address the coronavirus. The bill provides funds for additional equipment and supplies, expediting the development of a vaccine, and assisting state and local health departments. https://t.co/iFM27q7iHT

Today, along with several colleagues, I introduced the Forgotten Vietnam Veterans Act. This bipartisan legislation will provide benefits to nearly 3,000 veterans who currently don’t qualify for benefits they’ve earned. 

Read more here: https://t.co/A72r3We9NS

Had a great meeting today with members of the Greater Lafayette Chamber of Commerce. We discussed a wide array of issues from infrastructure, workforce development, to the importance of mental health. https://t.co/weXPCk6UvY
There are 81,954 soldiers who remain unaccounted-for. With the work of the DPAA, we can bring home our fallen soldiers and allow their families to lay them to rest. https://t.co/Xwcy97TsZM

Last month, I had the opportunity to visit the Defense POW/MIA Accounting Agency’s lab at Offutt Air Force Base. Their remarkable work identifying remains of fallen soldiers is providing appropriate closure for so many families. https://t.co/QxwtBvpV4x

I’m saddened by the passing of @NASA mathematician & champion of STEM education, Katherine Johnson. She was an American icon that broke down racial and social barriers. Her contribution in calculating trajectories that allowed Apollo 11 to land on the moon were invaluable.
We must take every opportunity to strengthen investment in R&D so we can continue breaking boundaries and moving our economy forward. https://t.co/ph6ig792Qa

America’s future is bright, and I look forward to working alongside the President and my colleagues to deliver common sense policy that supports all Americans.

Tonight, President Trump delivered a strong vision for continued economic prosperity, our national security and standing against socialism. Under President Trump we have seen major trade agreements signed, stronger border security, our military strengthened and low unemployment

President Trump signing USMCA means more good news for Indiana. The Indiana economy has 2,000 manufacturers and 61,000 jobs with exports to Mexico and Canada. I was proud to support USMCA, because this trade agreement is a big victory for Hoosiers! #IN04 https://t.co/VyR02cs4ze
Last week I visited with employees of Bayer Crop Sciences in Remington. Their facility packages more than 2 million bushels of seed per year! https://t.co/q5B6pIZk3G
